1.speaker: PANDA
1.character: 僕の家の朝は早いです
1.definition: The mornings at my house start early.

2.speaker: PANDA
2.character: 朝起きて一番に　中庭に集まって家族みんなで太極拳をします
2.definition: As soon as everyone wakes up, we all gather in the yard to practice Tai Chi.

3.speaker: PANDA
3.character: お爺ちゃんが中国拳法の達人だからです
3.definition: The reason being, my grandfather is a master of Chinese martial arts.

4.speaker: PANDA
4.character: 太極拳が終わったら　朝ごはんを食べます
4.definition: As soon as we're done with Tai Chi, we eat breakfast.

5.speaker: PANDA MAMA
5.definition: How long are you planning on sleeping?

6.speaker: PANDA
6.character: 今日動物園休みなんだから　寝かせて（　^ω^）
6.definition: The zoo's closed today, so let me sleep.

7.speaker: PANDA MAMA
7.character: みんなとっくに起きて太極拳やって　朝ごはん食べてるわよ
7.definition: Everyone else has already gotten up, finished their Tai Chi, and are eating breakfast.

8.speaker: PANDA
8.character: 太極拳でしょう　ベッドの上でやる(*￣∇￣)ノ
8.definition: Tai Chi, right? I can do that in bed.

9.speaker: PANDA MAMA
9.definition: Good grief. Don't suck me up! Are you tired?

10.speaker: PENGUIN
10.character: 最近運動不足だから　肩こちゃって
10.definition: I haven't been exercising enough lately, so my shoulders are stiff.

11.speaker: PENGUIN
11.character: 笹子さん　ちょっと　肩もんでくれない
11.definition: Could you rub my shoulders, Miss Sasako?

13.speaker: PENGUIN
13.definition: What's wrong? I can't seem to find your shoulders.

14.speaker: SASAKO
14.character: ペンギンさんの肩って　どこにあるんですか
14.definition: Where exactly are your shoulders, Mr. Penguin? Huh? They're right here. Can't you tell?

16.speaker: PENGUIN
16.character: じゃ　白熊君　肩揉んでくれる
16.definition: Then could you rub my shoulders, Polar Bear? Sure.

17.speaker: PENGUIN
17.character: 刺さってる　刺さってるw(ﾟДﾟ)w

19.speaker: PANDA
19.character: ペンギンさん　来てたの

20.speaker: PENGUIN
20.character: 動物園のバイト　今日は休み
20.definition: You have the day off from the zoo today? Yep. Could I get the usual, Miss Sasako?

21.speaker: SASAKO
21.definition: A large serving of bamboo, coming right up.

22.speaker: PANDA
22.character: 白熊君のお店　今日も人いっぱいだね
22.definition: Polar Bear's café is crowded again today.

23.speaker: PENGUIN
23.character: コーヒーも食べ物も美味しいよね
23.definition: That's because the coffee and the food are excellent.

24.speaker: PANDA
24.definition: It has a nice atmosphere, too.

26.speaker: PANDA
26.character: おしゃれな女の子がいっぱいだね
26.definition: There are lots of pretty girls, too. There sure are.

27.speaker: PANDA
27.character: 珍しい動物も来てるよね

29.speaker: PANDA
29.character: カフェやってる白熊君って格好よくない"o((>ω< ))o"
29.definition: Polar Bear is pretty cool for running a café, isn't he?

31.speaker: PANDA
31.character: まあ　お客でダラダラしてるペンギンさんは
31.definition: However, since you're always lazing around here as a customer,

32.speaker: PANDA
32.character: とくには格好よくないね
32.definition: you're not as cool, Mr. Penguin.

33.speaker: PENGUIN
33.character: 僕と比べるのはやめてくれない(*′Д`)

34.speaker: PENGUIN
34.character: あ　白熊君　カフェモカ頂戴
34.definition: Oh, Polar Bear, one café mocha, please {\i1}(choudai){\i0}.

35.speaker: PENGUIN
35.definition: That would be a low dining table {\i1}(chabudai){\i0}.

37.speaker: PENGUIN
37.definition: Those would be brothers {\i1}(kyoudai){\i0}. {\i1}Please{\i0}, okay? Here you go, one café mocha.

38.speaker: PENGUIN
38.definition: Couldn't you just do that from the beginning?

40.speaker: POLAR BEAR
40.character: 笹子さん　ちょっと出てくるね
40.definition: I'm going to step out for a bit, Miss Sasako. Oh, okay, Mr. Polar Bear. Take care!

41.speaker: PANDA
41.character: そうだ　僕もカフェを開いてみたらどうかな
41.definition: I know! What if I open up a café, too? Really? You?

44.speaker: PANDA
44.character: どんなカフェにしようかなぁ
44.definition: I wonder what kind of café it would be.

45.speaker: PANDA
45.character: まったりできる　レトロなカフェがいいな
45.definition: I think it should be mellow, with a retro feel.

46.speaker: PENGUIN
46.character: うん　コンセプトは悪くないね

49.speaker: PENGUIN
49.definition: Please don't say that about yourself.

51.speaker: PANDA
51.character: お店に中にね　僕のコレクションも飾ろうかな
51.definition: I think I'm going to decorate the interior with my collection.

52.speaker: PENGUIN
52.character: パンダ君のコレクションって　パンダグッヅ
52.definition: And your collection consists of panda items? Yep. They're super cute!

54.speaker: PANDA
54.definition: Is there a problem? No, not really. Go on.

55.speaker: PANDA
55.character: 当店のおすすめは日替わり竹ランチです
55.definition: Our specialty is the Daily Special Bamboo Lunch.

56.speaker: PANDA
56.character: お品書きはこちらです
56.definition: Here's our menu. Bamboo Deluxe Special.

62.speaker: PANDA
62.character: ……竹定食　松　竹　梅
62.definition: Bamboo Sets: Your choice of Pine, Bamboo, or Plum.

63.speaker: PENGUIN
63.character: ちょっと　ちょっと

64.speaker: PENGUIN
64.character: パンダ君の好物しかおいてないじゃない　そのカフェ
64.definition: You're only serving things you like at your café.

65.speaker: PANDA
65.character: 僕の好きなものは　皆もきっと好きだよ
65.definition: I'm sure that everyone will like the things I like.

67.speaker: PENGUIN
67.definition: You're not going to carry any raw fish?

68.speaker: PANDA
68.character: カフェに生魚はおいてないでしょう
68.definition: They don't have raw fish at cafés.

69.speaker: PENGUIN
69.character: カフェに竹なんておいてないでしょう
69.definition: They don't have bamboo at cafés either.

70.speaker: PANDA
70.character: しろくまカフェにはおいてあるよ
70.definition: They do at Polar Bear's Café.

71.speaker: PENGUIN
71.character: 頼むのパンダ君だけでしょう
71.definition: You're the only one that orders it, though.

72.speaker: PENGUIN
72.character: 僕はやっぱり生魚おいて欲しいね
72.definition: I'd like it if you carried raw fish. Really? We do have boiled young bamboo though. That'd be a very different genre.

74.speaker: PENGUIN
74.character: だいたいその竹定食の松　竹　梅って紛らわしいよ
74.definition: Not to mention your Bamboo Sets of Pine, Bamboo, and Plum are rather confusing.

76.speaker: PENGUIN
76.character: まあ　竹中心のメニューだと　お客さんはあんまりこないよ
76.definition: You're not going to get  many customers with a menu based solely on bamboo. What? There'll be tons!

77.speaker: PENGUIN
77.definition: Exactly what makes you think that?

78.speaker: PANDA
78.character: ラマさんはパンダカフェ来てくれるよね
78.definition: You'll come to Panda's Café, right, Mr. Llama?

79.speaker: LLAMA
79.character: 僕竹食べるとお腹痛くなっちゃうんです
79.definition: I get a stomachache when I eat bamboo.

80.speaker: PANDA
80.character: どうしよう　ペンギンさん
80.definition: What should I do, Mr. Penguin?

81.speaker: PENGUIN
81.character: 普通の料理も出したら
81.definition: Why don't you offer some normal food, too?

82.speaker: PENGUIN
82.character: ほら　パスタとかさあ

83.speaker: PANDA
83.definition: Bamboo pasta! That's a great idea!

84.speaker: PENGUIN
84.definition: Er, let's leave out the bamboo?

85.speaker: PANDA
85.character: やってみたいなあ　パンダカフェ（～o￣▽￣)～o
85.definition: I really want to open Panda's Café.

86.speaker: POLAR BEAR
86.character: 悪い予感がするね  ヽ(´Д`；)ﾉ
86.definition: I have a bad feeling about this.

89.speaker: PANDA
89.character: はい　竹いっちょう
89.definition: One order of bamboo coming right up!

90.speaker: PANDA
90.character: 大盛りもできますよ　どうしますか
90.definition: We can make it a large serving if you'd like. What do you say?

92.speaker: PENGUIN
92.character: パンダ君じゃダメだね　僕がカフェやるよ
92.definition: Your idea just doesn't work, Panda. I'll open a café. What kind of café will it be?

93.speaker: PENGUIN
93.character: そうだね　ペンギンカフェ
93.definition: Let's see... I'll call it Penguin's Café. Very original.

94.speaker: PENGUIN
94.character: いやいや　和風のカフェなんだよ

95.speaker: PENGUIN
95.character: メニューは　そうだな
95.definition: Let's see, the menu will center around alcohol and raw fish.

96.speaker: PANDA
96.character: 和風カフェっていうより　お寿司屋さんみたいなメニューだね
96.definition: That sounds like a menu fora sushi restaurant, not a Japanese-style café.

97.speaker: PENGUIN
97.character: コンセプトは四季おり売りの新鮮な海の幸を
97.definition: The concept will be a café where you can eat the season's freshest seafood

98.speaker: PENGUIN
98.character: 店主が選んだ　こだわりのお酒でいただけるカフェ
98.definition: along with the best sake, hand-picked by the owner.

99.speaker: PANDA
99.character: それカフェじゃなくて　お寿司屋さんじゃない
99.definition: That's a sushi restaurantnot a café, right?

100.speaker: PENGUIN
100.definition: No, it's not. Also, in the middle of the café, there'll be an aquarium.

101.speaker: PENGUIN
101.character: 水槽の中では魚が泳いでいて
101.definition: There'll be fish swimming around in it

102.speaker: PENGUIN
102.character: お客さんは自分の選んだ魚を食られるの
102.definition: and customers can choose which fish they want to eat. There aren't any cafés with fish tanks.

103.speaker: PANDA
103.character: カフェっぽさも入れてよ
103.definition: You need something a café would have.

104.speaker: PENGUIN
104.character: カフェっぽさ　入ってない
104.definition: Something a café would have?You don't get it? It's Penguin's {\i1}Café{\i0}.

106.speaker: SASAKO
106.character: だったら　コーヒー出したりしたらどうですか
106.definition: Then, why don't you try serving coffee?

107.speaker: PENGUIN
107.character: でも　市場まで魚の仕入れがあるかな
107.definition: Well, I'd be busy getting the fish from the fish market.

108.speaker: PENGUIN
108.character: そこまで手が回るかな
108.definition: I don't know if I'd be able to handle coffee, too.

109.speaker: PANDA
109.character: やめちゃえば　カフェ
109.definition: You might as well hang up the café idea.

110.speaker: PENGUIN
110.character: 何言ってるの　やるよ　僕は
110.definition: What are you talking about?! I'm totally going to do it!

111.speaker: PENGUIN
111.character: へ　いらっしゃい　o(*≧▽≦)ツ

112.speaker: PENGUIN
112.character: 旦那　何しやしょうか(｀・ω・´)
112.definition: Sir, what can I get'cha? Change everything back.

113.speaker: LLAMA
113.character: ラマカフェはどうですか

114.speaker: PANDA
114.definition: What kind of café is it?

115.speaker: LLAMA
115.character: ラマがいるカフェなんですけど
115.definition: It's a café with llamas in it.

116.speaker: PENGUIN
116.definition: Well, that's original. Would you be able to carry the coffee? It would all depend on balance.

117.speaker: LLAMA
117.character: コンセプトとしては店内のラマに草をあげたり
117.definition: As for the concept, it'll be a café where you can feed the llamas grass,

118.speaker: LLAMA
118.character: 毛繕いしたり　自由にかわいがって　いいカフェなんです
118.definition: groom them, and adore them freely.

119.speaker: PENGUIN
119.definition: It's like a Cat Café. You can groom the llamas. Isn't that amazing?

120.speaker: PENGUIN
120.character: そうかな　楽しいのそれ
120.definition: I don't know. Is that actually fun? Not only that, you can pick your favorite llama and take them outside for a walk. I'll take this llama.

121.speaker: GUY
121.character: ありがとうございま～～す

122.speaker: PENGUIN
122.character: ちょっと　草食べってかない
122.definition: Do you want to stop to eat some grass? It needs a bit of salt.

124.speaker: PENGUIN
124.definition: I'm having a hard time thinking that'd be fun.

125.speaker: PANDA
125.character: やっぱりパンダカフェが一番だよ
125.definition: Panda's Café is the best, without a doubt.

126.speaker: PENGUIN
126.character: ペンギンカフェじゃない
126.definition: Don't you mean Penguin's Café? Hey, what do you think, Polar Bear? Llama's Café.

130.speaker: PANDA
130.character: どのカフェがいいと思う
130.definition: Which café do you think is the best?

133.speaker: PANDA
133.character: やっぱりパンダカフェだよね
133.definition: I'm telling you, it's all about Panda's Café.

134.speaker: PENGUIN
134.character: え　ペンギンカフェでしょう
134.definition: What? Surely you mean Penguin's Café. No, no, it's Llama's Café. H-Hey! Please listen!

136.speaker: SASAKO
136.character: えーと　そうですね
136.definition: Well, let's see... There's a panda-like Miss Sasako, right?

137.speaker: PENGUIN
137.character: え　それじゃパンダカフェと変わらないじゃない
137.definition: Then that wouldn't be any different from Panda's Café.

138.speaker: LLAMA
138.character: いえいえ　ラマっぽい笹子さんが
138.definition: No, no. There's a llama-like Miss Sasako and...
